name: places/ChIJI_keZFlZwokR4Wzm0XJtYm0
formattedAddress: 418 E 71st St, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 418 E 71st St, New York, NY 10021, USA

originalText.text: This place is a disgusting convoluted mess. The doctor my dad was assigned to clearly does not want to be there. All he does for therapy are useless puzzles that don't prep him for his evaluation. When it was finally time for his evaluation, the white girl who administered the test had an obnoxious attitude and made my dad feel insecure. He has terrible anxiety and she was very unprofessional. Finally when he was seen by the doctor, they just recommended him more useless therapy. All they care about is making money. The only ones who show my dad any kind of warmth are the front desk downstairs but that’s it

originalText.text: The receptionist in the front has a great personality very professional and a true beauty from the inside out. She is so funny and upbeat she is like a cup of coffee and smiles. The staff is also very helpful and nice they help a lot with my healing process from this head injury.

text.text: The receptionist in the front has a great personality very professional and a true beauty from the inside out. She is so funny and upbeat she is like a cup of coffee and smiles. The staff is also very helpful and nice they help a lot with my healing process from this head injury.

originalText.text: The evaluation for my father was amazing. My father has been through a very tough time since his accident and has been suffering from anxiety. Miguel made him feel very comfortable and at ease. My father gets very frustrated when he cannot recall information. But Miguel made reassured him that they are trying to help him. Miguel took the time to briefly find out who my father is and if it wasn’t for him, my father would have not gone through with the test. Thank you Miguel! He definitely deserves a promotion!

text.text: The evaluation for my father was amazing. My father has been through a very tough time since his accident and has been suffering from anxiety. originalText.text:
I have to give credit to Dr Christine Lee, your methods are amazing and life changing. All the staff at the Queens location are terrific and professional. Today I realized the importance of the puzzles and games.  Cognitive therapy helped me realized the severity of a TBI. .
Thank you to the staff for your help and concern.

text.text:
I have to give credit to Dr Christine Lee, your methods are amazing and life changing. All the staff at the Queens location are terrific and professional. Today I realized the importance of the puzzles and games.  Cognitive therapy helped me realized the severity of a TBI. .
Thank you to the staff for your help and concern.

originalText.text:
This center and staff members  have been my anchor and support throughout these  two years and 8 months.. The  specific treatments and emotional support  for my brain injury , has helped me  gain confidence and trust in my self and the process. I am not cured but have been given tools  to lead a healthier, happier new way of living  with my condition.
The Pandemic did not change our sessions we continued to have them once a week  till now , thru zoom .I was partnered with another patient who shared the similar condition and has been an unbelievable journey for all of us because of the system and support.
Thank you CCC and staff members who walked with me in this journey .
